message.content: This question requires knowledge about the composition and formation of sand dunes. Sand dunes are made up of tiny particles of weathered rocks, minerals, and organic material. These particles are generally composed of silica, which is the raw material used to make glass. Option (A) is incorrect because nitrogen-rich top soil is not the main component of sand dunes. Option (B) is incorrect because while sand dunes can be described as giant hills, they are not made of tiny beads. Option (D) is incorrect because sand dunes are not composed of small groups of parasites.

Option (B) is misleading because while sand dunes can be described as giant hills, they are not made of tiny beads. Option (D) is unrelated to sand dunes as it refers to parasites, which have no connection to the formation of sand dunes.
